Coach and develop junior data engineers to be more effective individual contributors

Passion for data, new data technologies, and discovering new and interesting solutions to smeet the organisation's data needs
Experience in designing and operating Terabyte scaled data infrastructure that can efficiently and reliably process both structured and unstructured datasets
Proficient with modern data engineering practices e.g. building fault-tolerant pipelines, handling and logging errors, monitoring the system, understanding how to scale up, addressing continuous integration, knowledge of administration, ensuring a reliable and deterministic pipeline
Team player with excellent communication skills to communicate with the fellow engineers to coordinate development of various data products and pipelines, and launch of any new product features to data scientist and threat researchers
We are looking for a candidate with 5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role who have experience architecting and operating a big data infrastructure.

Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Elasticsearch

Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Airflow etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function languages: Python, Java, Scala etc.
Experience with ML and MLOps frameworks and with e.g. SparkML, MLflow

Motional is a driverless technology company making autonomous vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality. We're driven by something more.
Our journey is always people first.
We aren't just developing driverless cars; we're creating safer roadways, more equitable transportation options, and making our communities better places to live, work, and connect. Our team is made up of engineers, researchers, innovators, dreamers and doers, who are creating a technology with the potential to transform the way we move.
Higher purpose, greater impact.
We're creating first-of-its-kind technology that will transform transportation. To do so successfully, we must design for everyone in our cities and on our roads. We believe in building a great place to work through a progressive, global culture that is diverse, inclusive, and ensures people feel valued at every level of the organization. Diversity helps us to see the world differently; it's not only good for our business, it's the right thing to do.
Scale up, not starting up.
Our team is behind some of the industry's largest leaps forward, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world's first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world's longest-standing public robotaxi fleet. We're driven to scale; we're moving towards commercialization of our technology, and we need team members who are ready to embrace change and challenges.
Formed as a joint venture between Hyundai Motor Group and Aptiv, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives. Headquartered in Boston, Motional has operations in the U.S and Asia. For more information, visit www.Motional.com and follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.

Motional AD Inc. is an EOE. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To comply with Federal Law, we participate in E-Verify. All newly-hired employees are queried through this electronic system established by the DHS and the SSA to verify their identity and employment eligibility.

Description:
Are you someone who spent at least three years of your career in data and analytics?
Are you tech-savvy and someone whoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s willing to take new challenges?
Are you looking to work with innovative, collaborative, dependable and passionate people?
Are you someone with the right balance of tech and analytics Ã¢â‚¬â€œ can do coding but can also solve business pain points through the use of data?
Sounding like something you have been waiting for? Then read on, this is for you!
Your new employer: A media group that aspires to inspire, innovate, and drive culture forward!

Your new employer humbly started its passion project, a sneakers website, back in 2005 and evolved to a publicly listed media company in 2016. Having the drive to create a lifestyle universe to uncover the emerging trends in fashion and culture, the company expanded into three major divisions Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Digital Media, Creative Agency, and E-Commerce retail store. Being an international company, your new employer has 300+ employees across APAC, USA, and EuropeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s major cities, with physical offices in Hong Kong, Shanghai, Tokyo, London, New York, and LA.
Their flagship platform boasts the latest trends in fashion, art, design, and culture. They are the leading online destination for menÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s contemporary fashion and streetwear and so they made the platform to be available in 6 languages and has a wide readership across 10+ countries.
The companyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s core motivation of educating a global, influential audience in the context of fashion, arts, design, and music has been drive by a team of passionate and dedicated tech-savvy people who are in constant pursuit of self-improvement and building the company together.

The Role: Data Engineer

Due to the continuous hyper growth of the company, they need you right now! As the Data Engineer, you will work together with the Head of Analytics to build the cloud infrastructure of the company. You will have the opportunity to build, provide solutions and actionable recommendations with the technological know-how and implementation Ã¢â‚¬â€œ focusing on web and customer analytics.

The Data Analyst will play a crucial role in our organization by collecting, processing, and analyzing data to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent data manipulation skills, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Collection: Gather data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and external datasets, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Data Cleaning and Transformation: Clean, preprocess, and transform data as needed to prepare it for analysis. Handle missing data and outliers appropriately.
Data Analysis: Conduct statistical and exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations. Use various data analysis techniques and tools to derive insights.
Data Visualization: Create clear and informative data visualizations (charts, graphs, dashboards) to present findings to stakeholders. Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Python libraries.
Report Generation: Generate regular and ad-hoc reports to communicate key insights and findings to management and other teams within the organization.
Predictive Modeling: Develop and maintain predictive models to support forecasting and decision-making processes.
Data Documentation: Maintain documentation for data sources, methodologies, and data analysis processes. Ensure data privacy and compliance with relevant regulations.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support for specific projects.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated with industry trends, data analysis techniques, and tools to improve data analysis capabilities.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related discipline. Master's degree is a plus.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, or R.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of statistical analysis and data mining techniques.
Attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Team player with the ability to work collaboratively and independently.
Experience with machine learning and predictive modeling is a plus.
Knowledge of data privacy and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR) is advantageous.
Banking experience is a must

Description
Position Overview:

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Business Intelligence Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a key member of our BI data analytics department, you will play a crucial role in extracting insights from large volumes of data, driving data-driven decision-making, and contributing to strategic initiatives for all countries (MY/AU/PH/SG). The successful candidate will be responsible for data visualization, resolving data quality issues, implementing data automation solutions, automating report generation, and exploring potential machine learning projects. Your expertise will be pivotal in forecasting, generating actionable insights, and communicating findings effectively through presentations.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Automation: Implement and maintain automated data pipelines and processes to streamline data collection, transformation, integration, and report generation, enhancing efficiency and reducing manual effort.
Data Manipulation: Manipulate and analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business growth and inform strategic decisions.
Data Visualization: Develop and maintain effective dashboards, reports, and interactive data visualizations that effectively convey complex information to stakeholders and monitor key performance metrics.
Data Quality: Identify and address data quality issues by collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data sources.
Machine Learning : Collaborate with team to explore machine learning opportunities, leveraging data to build predictive models and enhance business processes.
Forecasting: Utilize historical data and statistical methods to create accurate forecasts and predictive models for various business metrics.
Insight Generation: Analyze data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement, generating actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making.
Effective Storytelling: Translate complex data findings into clear, concise, and compelling narratives using PowerPoint and other presentation tools to communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Market Research: Conduct thorough market research to analyst market penetration and identify opportunities for expansion and growth.

Requirements
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related field.
Proven experience working with large volumes of data and performing data analysis.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, or similar.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, SQL, Java, or similar.
Strong problem-solving skills and a keen eye for identifying data quality issues.
Familiarity with data automation tools and techniques.
Experience with automating report generation and distribution.
Experience with machine learning concepts and potential applications.
Strong forecasting skills using statistical methods and tools.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Proficiency in using PowerPoint or other presentation tools for effective storytelling.
Growth mindset, adaptability, and willingness to learn and explore new technologies like AI to automate workflows.
If you are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights, thrive in a collaborative and independent environment, and possess the skills to drive data-driven insights generation and automate workflows, we encourage you to apply and join our dedicated analytics team.

Job Overview
We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Pricing Analyst to help determine the daily settlement price on our exchange. The ideal candidate has excellent analytical skills, a deep understanding of financial markets, and a firm grasp on data analysis tools and techniques. You will play a critical role in ensuring the stability and integrity of our exchange by conducting daily price analyses, forecasting, and implementing robust pricing strategies.

Responsibilities
Analyse complex financial information and market data to derive the daily settlement prices for our exchange.
Regularly review trading activity, market conditions, and statistical models to ensure that pricing aligns with market dynamics.
Continuously evaluate settlement price calculation methodologies to suggest refinement where necessary to improve accuracy and efficiency
Conduct historical data analysis to identify trends, anticipate changes, and make proactive pricing decisions.
Collaborate with our Operations, Risk, and Technology teams to gather necessary data inputs and integrate them into the daily settlement process.
Engage with market data providers to acquire market quotes, and validate the reasonableness of these quotes for potential inclusion in the settlement price determination.
Monitor and assess data sources for discrepancies, anomalies, and potential errors, taking proactive measures to address issues
Apply advanced statistical techniques for potential outlier detection of market data and settlement prices
Monitor market and regulatory developments to ensure our pricing methodologies remain compliant and competitive.
Prepare and present daily reports summarizing the pricing methodology, including any changes, the reasoning behind them, and their expected impacts.
Prepare reports to detail noticeable settlement price trends and any significant observations
Work on special projects and perform additional duties as needed to improve our pricing methods and procedures.
Identify opportunities for process automation and collaborate with the technology & operations to implement enhancements
Maintain comprehensive documentation of pricing methodologies, processes and procedures

Requirements
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in financial analysis, preferably in a pricing analyst role.
Experience in Commodities markets for both physical and derivatives market.
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills, with a strong attention to detail.
Advanced knowledge of financial markets, derivatives, and pricing methodologies.
Proficiency in data analysis software and tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, R, Python).
Strong communication skills to effectively present complex information to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactive, self-starter who can work autonomously and as part of a team.
Experience in interaction with market data providers and market participants/customers and negotiation skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships.
Strong skills in statistical analysis, particularly in outlier detection and trend analysis.
Familiarity with regulatory requirements in the financial markets sector is preferred

As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for driving alignment on the business requirements for data labelling projects and ensure that relevant quality standards and timelines are met. You will analyse data labelling results and identify areas of improvement to develop suitable data labelling plans and strategies for optimising the efficiency and quality of projects.

It is possible that this role will be exposed to harmful content as part of the core role/as part of project/ in response to escalation requests/by chance.

Some content viewed may violate our community guidelines which include but are not limited to bullying; hate speech; child abuse; sexual assault; torture; bestiality; self-harm; suicide; and murder.

What will I be doing?
Work with stakeholders to understand the business requirements for data labeling projects. This includes understanding the data that needs to be labeled, the quality standards that need to be met, and the timeline for the project.
Develop data labeling plans and strategies. This includes identifying the best data labeling methods and tools and creating a schedule for the project.
Manage data labeling projects. This includes overseeing the work of data labelers, ensuring that the quality standards are met, and communicating with stakeholders on the progress of the project.
Analyze data labeling results. This includes evaluating the quality of the data that has been labeled and making recommendations for improvement.
Stay up-to-date on the latest trends in data labeling. This includes attending conferences, reading articles, and following industry experts.
Change Management: Help manage the process of change within the organization by analyzing the impact of proposed solutions and assisting with the implementation of changes.
Risk Assessment: Identify and assess potential risks associated with proposed solutions and suggest risk mitigation strategies.
Domain Knowledge: Develop a deep understanding of the industry, domain, and specific business area in which the BA operates to provide valuable insights and recommendations.
In addition to these core responsibilities, a business analyst for the data labeling industry may also be responsible for:
Providing insights into the business value of data labeling. This includes demonstrating how data labeling can be used to improve the quality of products and services and to make better business decisions.
Developing new data labeling methods and tools. This is a rapidly evolving field, and business analysts need to be able to stay ahead of the curve.
Building relationships with data labeling vendors. This is important for ensuring that the company has access to the best possible data labelling services
Qualifications
What should I bring with me?
You have a strong understanding of data labeling, as well as business analysis principles.
You are able to work independently and as part of a team
You are able to communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
You are able to think strategically and creatively and are able to adapt to change.

Job_Title: Data Analyst - Power BI / ETL / R / Python (Internal Audit Department)
Description:
Our Client a supply chain operator is in the midst of expanding their IT Team. This is a great opportunity to join a growing data science team IT. You will be a part of a diverse and global team that is leading the way in developing cargo solutions that make supply chains more agile, resilient, and sustainable.

Role
Data Extraction and Analysis: extract and analyse large volumes of data from various sources. He or she will gather relevant data for audit testing, identifying patterns, anomalies, and trends, and performing data-driven analysis to assess control effectiveness, detect fraud, or identify areas of risk.
Data Visualisation: create visually appealing and insightful dashboards, charts, and graphs to present audit findings and communicate complex data in a more understandable and impactful manner.
Data Analytics Tools and Techniques: use data analytics tools and techniques such as statistical analysis, regression modelling, data mining, and predictive analytics to assist internal auditors in identifying key risk indicators, conducting trend analysis, and predicting potential risks or control weaknesses.
Automation and Continuous Monitoring: automate repetitive audit tasks, such as data extraction, data cleansing, and report generation, by leveraging data analytics software or programming languages. This is to allow auditors to focus more on higher-value activities and perform continuous monitoring of key controls and indicators.
Fraud Detection and Prevention: to assist internal auditors in developing and implementing data-driven fraud detection and prevention techniques. He /she will analyze transactional data, identify suspicious patterns or outliers, and collaborate with auditors to design and implement controls that mitigate fraud risks effectively. Investigations assignments may also be conducted when required or on requests of management.
Data Governance and Data Quality: contribute to the establishment of robust data governance frameworks and data quality assurance processes and work closely with IT teams to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and availability, which is crucial for reliable audit testing and analysis.

Requirements

Education
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Management, Engineering, or a related field.
Skillsets and Experience
At least 4years of relevant working experience in data analytics, process improvement, and digital transformation.
Experience using data analytics tools and techniques to extract, analyze, and visualize large volumes of data.
Experience using robotics and intelligence tools to automate repetitive tasks and improve work processes.
Experience using business intelligence tools to create dashboards and reports that communicate data insights.
Knowledge of software (Galvanize Highbond) and analytics tools (ACL, Oracle Transaction Business Intelligence OTBI) is an advantage.
Prior experience working in Internal audit deparment would be an advantage.

Description

within the FairPrice retail business operation. This role will also serve as consultant for internal

delivery needs for divisional lines of business. The role will have responsibility for developing
and monitoring key performance metrics of business integration initiatives for evaluation of

Process and requirement development experience
Consulting experience strongly preferred
Strong verbal and written communication and leadership skills
Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations

5. Excellent verbal and written English communication skills with experience communicating the results of analyses.
6. Experience coaching, developing, and mentoring team members would be a key bonus for this role

We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

About SGInnovate
At SGInnovate, we build and scale Deep Tech startups into companies with global impact. We believe that hard global problems can be solved using Deep Tech, and Singapore, where we are based, is uniquely positioned to realise Deep Tech innovations that can tackle these challenges. Our Deep Tech Nexus Strategy is focused on adding tangible value to the Deep Tech startup ecosystem in two key areas Ã¢â‚¬â€œ development of Human Capital and deployment of Investment Capital. With the support of our partners and co-investors, we back entrepreneurial scientists through equity-based investments, access to talent and business-building advice. Our efforts are prioritised around emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Autonomous Tech, MedTech and Quantum Tech, which represent impactful and scalable answers to global challenges. SGInnovate is a private-limited company wholly owned by the Singapore Government. For more information, please visit www.sginnovate.com.

Overview
The Strategy Management Information Technology (SMIT) team is responsible for the digital transformation of SGInnovate. Be part of this exciting and pivotal effort to bring about positive and impactful changes to the organisation and the wider Deep Tech start up ecosystem. The SMIT team drives and oversees progress on two fronts: (1) key digital product transformation projects and (2) data & analytics asset development. Key digital products will impact both internal and external stakeholders by optimising the platform through which we conduct our business. Data & analytics asset development entails building the data pipeline from source to data warehouse, before finally delivering insights to end user via dashboards.
If the prospect of orchestrating strategical changes that are instrumental to the growth of SGInnovate and our key sector excites you, look no further and grow your career with us today!

Responsibilities
The role of a Data & Analytics Intern primarily looks at developing end-to-end data assets to deliver information and insights to internal stakeholders readily. He/she will report to the Data & Analytics Lead.
Typical tasks and responsibilities include:

Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Follow and adopt industry standards and agile development practices to accommodate rapid customer-driven specification changes.
Manage digital transformation projects and work with external vendors to ensure the seamless collection and delivery of data
You may be a good fit if you possess:
i. Tangible:
Interest in project and stakeholder management (e.g. Agile, waterfall, etc)
Strong passion for data & analytics with knowledge and/or experience for:
Data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, etc)
Data transformation via coding or tools (e.g. SQL, Python, VBA, R and/or Talend, Informatica, Alteryx, AWS glue, etc)
The management of databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MSSQL, etc)
Commercial cloud managed services (e.g. AWS Ã¢â‚¬â€œ EC2/S3/etc, GCP, etc)
Automation/workflow tools (e.g. RPA, PowerAutomate, etc)
Analytical techniques such as machine learning, text mining, web scraping, natural language processing, etc
Data Governance, Metadata Management

Excellent interpersonal, communication and project management skills
Team player and ability to collaborate with and manage stakeholders across different teams
Ability to host and drive discussion with multiple stakeholders
Independent and resourceful problem solver
Meticulous, structured, and methodical
Able to manage and excel in ambiguity to create structure from almost nothing

Job_Title: Analyst/Snr Analyst/Lead Analyst (Data Engineering & Infrastructure), Data Offic
Description:
What the role is
The Data Office champions the overall HR data strategy for the whole-of-government and PSD. We are responsible for end-to-end solutioning to allow PSD to use data effectively in developing its policies and programmes, as well as to drive adoption and evolution of HR data analytics across the public service.

To achieve this, the team leads initiatives relating to the refining existing practices and approaches to HR data analytics, encompassing the full spectrum of activities including infrastructure, data engineering, data operations and data governance.
What you will be working on
The Data Office champions the overall HR data strategy for the whole-of-government and PSD. We are responsible for end-to-end solutioning to allow PSD to use data effectively in developing its policies and programmes, as well as to drive adoption and evolution of HR data analytics across the public service.

To achieve this, the team leads initiatives relating to the refining existing practices and approaches to HR data analytics, encompassing the full spectrum of activities including infrastructure, data engineering, data operations and data governance.

[Specific Job Responsibilities]

The incumbent will be part of the Data Engineering & Infrastructure team supporting the operations and development of an IT system, which is a central repository of data from HR systems to facilitate whole-of-government analysis and reporting.

As part of the Data Engineering & Infrastructure team, you will:

Manage and support audit queries

Job_Title: Analyst, Operational Risk Mgt, Risk Mgt Dept
Description:
Operational Risk Management
Implementation of risk governance and regulatory compliance frameworks in APAC as part of 2LoD for assessing, monitoring and reporting operational risks inherent in business operations
Upkeep and operationalize Operational Risk Management frameworks, including formulation and maintenance of policies, procedures and standards to meet regulatory requirements
Work closely with stakeholders in the 3 lines of defence to implement appropriate risk governance/oversight, design/determine/establish metrics like KRIs, implement controls and promote best practices that drive operational risk management and regulatory compliance
Coordinate operational risk management efforts and manage Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) activities across the APAC Offices and with HO to drive timely completion of third party risk deliverables and resolution of key risk issues
Communicate technical concepts to non-technical audience and senior management and lead efforts to cultivate and promote a strong operational risk culture and ensure adherence to operational risk management policies, procedures and standards
Responsibilities
To arrange and facilitate SORMM (System Security & Operational Risk Management Meeting) every quarter.
To monitor and perform regular review of Operational Risk Key Risk Indicators (KRIs).
To review, monitor and analyse Operational Risk Events (OREs).
To support review of new product applications, administrative issues and other risk management-related tasks in APAC Offices.
To review the operational risk related issues in the Risk Register completed by the departments and APAC Offices.
To perform regular review of APAC Operational Risk Management Framework and functional reviews of APAC Offices' operational risk related policies/ procedures.
To establish framework for Operational Resilience.
Administrator of ORE module for Governance, Risk and Compliance system.
Facilitate training with APAC Offices.

Requirements
Good knowledge of Operational Risk Management regulatory requirements and industry standards.
Familiarity with ICAAP, operational resilience concepts (eg. Business Continuity Management, Disaster Recovery planning) and non-financial risk management (eg. Technology Risk, Third-Party Risk) will be favorably considered.
Minimum 2 years experience in operational risk management, preferably in banking or financial services.
Certifications such as FRM, PRM or any Operational Risk or Business Continuity Management-related qualifications would be advantageous.
Good project management skills and experience.
Ability to perform gap analysis of operational risk management policies and processes against new regulatory requirements and guidelines.
Self-starter and a critical thinker.
Proactive, resourceful and able to think and act strategically and tactically.
Able to multi-task and work independently under tight timelines.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Strong stakeholder management skills.
Culturally sensitive.

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.

About the Team
The Monetization Integrity Operations team plays a critical role in driving initiatives to mitigate risks in Ads and ensuring advertiser quality on our platform. The team also provides efficient and high quality reviews to unlock good revenue and focus on brand safety and user/Advertister experience.

Responsibilities

2. Bachelor degree or above, preferably with 1- 2 years of experience in technology/internet/social media/statistics or strategy field;

5. Adaptive to a multi-culture and cross-geo working environment
6. Excellent communication, influencing, and project management skills, with the ability to drive the simultaneous delivery of complex projects in collaboration with stakeholder teams.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Job_Title: Statistical Specialist (Data Analytics and Methodology), MRSD
Description:
What the role is
The position is located in the Manpower Research and Statistics Department (MRSD), Singapore. The department produces a wide range of national labour market statistics to facilitate informed decision-making within the government and the community-at-large.
The main role of the position is to collect, analyse and interpret data using innovative tools, methods and approaches to optimise survey operations and facilitate policy making and development.
What you will be working on
Leveraging on a variety of data sources (i.e survey data, administrative data), including big data to generate actionable insights.

Apply statistical techniques and data mining methods to identify patterns and trends, employment patterns, and labour market dynamics.

Designing user-friendly data visualization dashboards, presentation slides, charts and tables.

Undertake both qualitative and quantitative research and analysis, including predictive modelling, time-series forecasting. Commission research, draft terms of reference for research consultants and monitor and coordinate their work.

Draft and/or provide technical input into the development, peer review and editing of occupational/industry classification system reviews, working papers, reports, publications and other knowledge products and contribute to their dissemination.

Keeping up to date with advancements and developments in machine learning so as to leverage new tools and techniques.

Provide evidence-based technical content for social media, digital and other knowledge-sharing tools and platforms, with a view to reaching broad and diverse audiences.

Developing and implementing policies related to data governance policies, procedures and standards, including identifying and resolving data quality issues.

Perform other relevant duties as assigned.
What we are looking for
Tertiary qualifications with a preferred field of study in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other relevant field.

Experience in research and quantitative analysis. Candidates with coding and programming experience (e.g. Python, R) will be considered favourably.

Good knowledge and understanding of theories, trends and approaches in the area(s) of machine learning/deep learning, natural language processing, large language modelling and econometrics modelling.

Good research and analytical skills.

Good communication, presentation and writing skills.

Ability to maintain effective and collaborative working relationships with key stakeholders.

About Atome Financial
Headquartered in Singapore, Atome Financial is a consumer business unit under Advance Intelligence Group. The products under Atome Financial include:
Atome: A leading buy now pay later brand in Asia Pacific which is currently present in 10 markets and partners over 15,000+ top retailers. Key merchant partners include ZALORA, Sephora, Agoda, SHEIN and Zara.
Kredit Pintar: One of Indonesia's top digital lending apps, regulated and supervised by Indonesia's Financial Services Authority (OJK). Over 10 million downloads, 2 million customer reviews and with a 4.4-star rating on Google Play Store.
As part of the Advance Intelligence Group, a Series-D company and ranked No. 1 on LinkedIn's 2021 Top Startups List in Singapore with over 2,000+ staff worldwide, we are united by a shared vision and purpose: to Advance with Intelligence for a Better Life-for our customers, colleagues and communities.
Our culture is built on values that are core to who we are and what we stand for:
We foster an INNOVATION mindset
We achieve results with EFFICIENCY and excellence
We take pride in the QUALITY of our work
We uphold INTEGRITY in all we do
We embrace COLLABORATION to work across business lines and borders
You will primarily work on:
What you'll do:
Provide support and knowledge to the business through data & insights and process improvements.
Co-drive and co-develop the performance management program, as well as to support the execution of strategic goals
Participate in business discussions with the countries' leadership teams and assist in the translation of company-wide strategic goals into actionable business, financial and operational plans
Assist in the cascade of goals across the organization and partner with the business/stakeholders to collect performance data required to track and monitor agreed business outcomes
Manage KPI creation and design process with process owners
Troubleshoot with stakeholders for any inaccurate and/or incomplete KPI performance data
Support in conducting audits and reviews periodically, for presentation to key stakeholders
Sales Performance: Consolidate / validate sale performance; define, track and report sales performance metrics and trends. Provide visualization and analysis of performance data
Business Operations

3-4 years of data analytics related experience, with advanced excel skills
Familiar with analytical tools like Tableau
Analytical and problem-solving skills
High level of discretion, confidentiality, and ethics

Excellent multi-tasking skills in planning, managing and prioritising

Resilient and loves the speed and thrill of a fast-paced, get-things-done work environment

Summary Requirements:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Main Objective:
The main objective of the Master Data Analyst, APAC is to facilitate the creation and maintenance of high quality master data related to all Arthrex materials and customers for the Asia Pacific Region. By implementing and executing policies and procedures at the regional level to ensure master data meets global standards. This role plays an important part in protecting a key Arthrex asset: the master data that enables the company to share information, process transactions, plan and execute business operations globally.

Master Data Analyst serves as a liaison to the global Product Life Cycle Management, Procure to Purchase (PTP) and Order To Cash (OTC) process owners. Through these relationships, Master Data Analyst receives the tools, policies, procedure, training and on-going guidance necessary to ensure that the practices he/she is following at the Regional level are aligned with Global Master Data practices.

Master Data Analyst key stakeholders whom he/she will work on a regular basis
INC MDG (Master Data Governance): responsible for creating and maintaining material master data for finished goods and creating new SKUs
Subsidiary Data Requestors: various parties within a subsidiary-specific organization responsible for providing the source data of the material and customer master data needed in each country, ie: country inventory planners may provide material master data for locally purchased products (Retail), and product extension requests that would be facilitated through Master Data Analyst, APAC
Subsidiary Data Stewards: Local Regulatory, Operations, Customer Service, Finance, Sourcing and Distribution professionals who provide and use specific master data
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Master Data Analyst main duties and responsibilities: Data Administration, Data Stewardship, Product Lifecyle Management Facilitation and Process Improvements.

Data Administration includes those tasks necessary to set up and maintain Material Master and Customer Master data in the SAP Systems. They are:
Facilitate the creation of new material master data submitted by the subs data requestors
Perform costing run for the material within the region / plant
Maintain and/or enrich other related data eg: Purchase Information Records, Source Lists, etc
Create and/or amend customer master data after performing quality checks
Receive, analyze and implement requests for changes to material master and customer master data in cooperation with country data requestors and other country data stewards
Respond to requests from data users to analyze and help resolve data problems that may be causing down stream transactional issues
Maintain data cleanliness to ensure data integrity
Maintain the service level agreement agreed with subs data requestors and other subs data stewards
Data Stewardship includes setting up and maintaining the regional procedures necessary for creating and maintaining high quality data. They are:
Maintain and support strong working relationship with Subsidiary data requestors and other country data stewards
Measure and report on regional data quality and adherence to the service level agreement
Review existing processes and make recommendations to improve efficiency and accuracy, which adhering to the company processes
Coordinate with various key stakeholders, ie: quality, finance, to effectuate required attributes within material master for a smooth end to end transaction within SAP
Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) facilitation involves collaborating with commercial and Product Managers/Marketing to ensure that product lifecycle strategies are implemented timely and accurately in the ERP system. They are:
Establishing appropriate master data settings to support the new product ramp-up or phase-out strategies
Assist to speed products to market by planning for and streamlining material master data setup for new product launches
Facilitate the collection of relevant data to compile specific PLM strategies
Assist with or lead special projects, but not limited to Process Improvements, including presentations materials and other duties as assigned.
Incidental Duties:
The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned, as required, by management.

Education and Experience:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experiences
Minimum of 5 years Master Data experience or related experiences within Supply Chain

Knowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:
Excellent analytical abilities and attention to details
Knowledge of how the multiple SAP Master Data impact the business
Good written and oral English language communication skills.
Ability to work well within a group environment.

Machine, Tools, and/or Equipment Skills:
Intermediate to expert level Microsoft Excel
Good understanding of Microsoft Office Applications with a particular emphasis on mass data manipulation tools such as Excel (Pivot Tables, Macros and Vlookup)
Power BI and SAP R3 / HANA knowledge a MUST
Reasoning Ability:
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

Mathematical Skills
Ability to comprehend and apply mathematical principles to the degree required to perform the job based upon job requirements.

Ability to comprehend and apply language skills to the degree required to perform the job based upon the job requirements listed above. CRU is a global leader in commodities market analysis and consulting. We provide high quality data, market analysis, forecasts and advice to our customers in critical global industries, helping them take strategic, trading, investment and operational decisions.
Joining us means joining a global team of talented colleagues who will respect, trust, support and collaborate with you. You will be able to apply your knowledge and experience to a variety of real-world challenges facing key players in commodities markets, where your advice and insights will have a positive impact on decision-making across industries.

Join us

Form and shape CRUÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s market views, working with the contribution of colleagues and own market analysis work. This includes the interpretation and communication of government policy and its influence on both the steel industry and end-use markets.

Your work will help major international companies, industry associations and governments make the best judgments for the good of their stakeholders and efficient natural resource allocation. Coordinate with other workers to resolve discrepancies between administrative and actual stock
Create and maintain inventory overviews and processes for accurately managing inventory
Create client KPI reports + additional ad-hoc reports account management could require.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Complete all tasks with a high degree of accuracy, attention to detail, and follow-up
Ensure professional, accurate, and timely communication to complete tasks and resolve issues
Analyze and problem-solve effectively and efficiently

Gather and disseminate information to and from multiple departments clearly and quickly
Oversee all phases of assigned projects to ensure completion within budget and schedule

2-3 years of experience in high-volume, fast-paced analytical role

Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and ability to multitask/prioritize based on urgency
Must have experience with report-generating software, such as Pentaho

Overview of the Team
Our Portfolio Strategy & Risk Group (PSRG) actively guides the firm's investment activities and drives sustainable returns, while protecting the portfolio and the institution. The group actively explores overlay and alternative portfolio strategies to enhance our portfolio returns.
The Quantitative Strategy team is a part of PSRG and supports its activities through 3 key areas: (1) Building a recurring income portfolio, (2) Quantamental investing to complement the firmÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s fundamental bottom-up investing; (3) Alpha generation and portfolio construction, where the team looks at several strategies to enhance risk-adjusted portfolio returns.

Roles & Responsibilities
The intern will assist the team in building up the infrastructure for quantitative analysis and support ongoing research activities. Specific responsibilities can include:
Automate signal generation and tracking of trading ideas in the research phase. Work with team to deploy previously tracked signals to live portfolio
Assist with building infrastructure to maintain quantitatively managed portfolio
Build dashboards to monitor market and portfolio performance
Assist with signal research activities leveraging traditional and alternative data sources

Qualifications/Requirements

Job_Title: Analyst / Senior Analyst, Policy and Research
Description:
[What the role is]
Conduct research and analysis to strengthen the organisational policy and planning process.
[What you will be working on]
Develop and review strategic policies to ensure the organisation remains responsive to changes in the internal/external environment. This includes identifying policies for review, gathering and analysing data, and developing and presenting evidence-based policy recommendations.
Collaborate on and manage research projects to ensure quality and sound research contributing to strengthened policy, planning and engagement functions. This includes conceptualising research studies, procuring research services, liaising with project partners and stakeholders, monitoring project deliverables, sensemaking of findings and developing and presenting recommendations.
Identify key research areas and activities for future strategic plans and/or develop plausible future scenarios to ensure the organisation is anticipatory and remains resilient in upcoming developments and future challenges.
Drive initiatives to build policy, research and programme evaluation capabilities and culture within the organisation. This includes developing forums for discussions and building and sustaining platforms for organisational resources.
Support strategic planning functions. This includes facilitating planning and performance reporting sessions.
Forge and strengthen policy and research partnerships with relevant agencies, academics, think tanks and NGOs.
[What we are looking for]
Candidate must possess at least tertiary education in a related discipline such as Public Policy, Social Sciences and Statistics. Graduates of other disciplines with relevant experience are welcome to apply.
At least 3 years' experience in related field e.g., Policy development, Quantitative or Qualitative data analysis & research, Statistical analysis and/or Basic data analytics, Project management.
Strong interest in current affairs especially socio-religious issues.
Excellent communication & interpersonal skills with the ability to engage internal and/or external partners and stakeholders.
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills.
Passionate learner and eager to try new approaches.
Successful candidate will be appointed on contract basis.
In general, applicants can expect to hear from us within 4 weeks of the close of the application window. In the event where we receive a high number of applications, applicants will receive an update on their status within 6 weeks of the close of the application window.
If you are facing issues submitting your application, please contact us at careers@muis.gov.sg for assistance.

About Sleek
Sleek is on a mission to revolutionize how entrepreneurs operate their business. We want to give small business owners peace of mind and the power of online solutions to allow them to focus on what they do best - growing their business. As we work for our thousands of customers, we gather millions of data points about their business, and in turn we transform those into useful, actionable insights and recommendations to accelerate their growth through smart algorithms.
We are a team of 400 builders from 18 countries, with offices in Singapore, Philippines, India, Vietnam, Hong Kong, Australia and the UK committed to delivering a delightful experience to our clients!
You will be working in the Data & Analytics organization to solve a wide range of business problems leveraging advanced analytics. You will deploy a flexible analytical skill set to deliver insightful data and analysis and model business scenarios. Your principal goal will be to use data to drive better business decisions. This means translating data into meaningful insights and recommendations and, where relevant, proactively implement improvements. You will be developing the business reporting and analysis for our internal operations world-wide. The job will require working closely with the various Business Units to understand their business question as well as the whole data team to understand and access available data.
By submitting a job application, you confirm that you have read and agree to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates.

Position Duties

Drive analytical problem-solving and deep dives. Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine problems, applying advanced quantitative methods.
Collaborate with a wide variety of cross-functional partners to determine business needs, drive analytical projects from start to finish.
Align with involved stakeholders to set up dashboards and reports to drive data driven decision across all departments
Working very closely with our Data team, Tech and Product team to understand the business logic to generate accurate reports and correct analysis
Requirements
Performance Standards
Able to commit for a period of at least 4 months
Currently pursuing a degree in Business Science, Engineering or relevant disciplines with a focus on data.
Good knowledge in SQL, R and Python.
Experience in data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Google DataStudio or equivalent) will be an added advantage.

More about Sleek!
At Sleek, we work in a fast-paced start-up environment. We have a strong culture built around our five core values: Simplicity, Loyalty, Excellence, Entrepreneurship, Kindness. As a deliberately multicultural team, our team comprises more than 18 nationalities and spoken languages.
We consider the companyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s success to be a result of committed individual and team efforts, and are looking to onboard talented and creative people who want to make a difference. Corporate social responsibility is a passion, and as an equal opportunity employer we aim at making the world a better place. We are the 1st international incorporation and accounting brand to achieve B Corp certification status, meeting the highest standards of social and environmental impact performance. With a strong commitment to also make Sleek a great place to work, we offer a flexible working environment where we empower every team member to be the best they can be - regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, age or identity.
If you think you would be a good fit for our mission, we look forward to hearing from you!
Benefits
Hybrid working arrangement

Strong understanding of data modeling concepts, principles, and methodologies.

Good communication and presentation skills
Experience in financial and insurance sector will be advantageous.
Flexibility to adjust priorities and approaches in response to evolving business needs.
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in work deliverables.

Innovation Support Services
Job Description
The position will report to the Senior Learning Innovation Advocate under the Innovation Centre (IC) at Institute for Adult Learning (IAL). It supports the knowledge creation and evaluation / impact measurement of the Innovation Centre related to learning innovation in Singapore.

He/she leads the conceptualization and execution of fact-finding related projects such as the state of learning innovation activities in the sector, intervention and programme evaluation, including impact measurement activities such as collection and analysis of post-event data, and other relevant information and data related projects.

He/she will also be responsible for content creation for the iN.LAB microsite in the form of horizon scanning, trend monitoring, articles or case studies.

He/she will use his/her knowledge to organize roundtables and contribute to theme development for the innovSeries. Key activities related to these responsibilities include:
Lead the design, development and implementation of specific projects including:
Conceptualize and develop project proposal;
Prepare and plan project logistics, schedule and activities.
Review, collate and analyze literature and findings to inform project design;
Design data collection instruments;
Propose the different techniques appropriate at different stages of the project;
Data gathering, processing and cleaning in preparation for data mining and analysis;
Analysis and writing in required formats (reports, papers, articles); and
Manages the bibliographies and literature review of the reports.
Plan and conduct engagement activities with the team and stakeholders to support the intended outcomes of the project.
Manage and maintain the data bases as required.
Write up and report on project activities as required.
Participate in the evaluation of tenders for approved IC projects.
Plan, manage and implement events including roundtables, seminars, visiting speaker engagements, focus groups and activities related to approved projects.
Collaborate on other relevant projects (e.g. with Research Division) including conceptualization, scoping, designing, collecting data, analysis, and dissemination.
Write and produce papers and publications to inform IALÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s innovation activities and efforts and inform the community of the trends and developments in learning innovation.
Contribute to evaluation efforts of IALÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s initiatives and efforts in learning innovation.
Perform other duties as required.
Job Requirements
A degree in the humanities/ arts and social sciences. Preference will be given to candidates with a graduate research degree.
At least 5 years of work experience, preferably in the relevant research or policy areas, such as research experience related to any or combinations of learning and development, adult education, learning and performance, work and learning and/or working experience that requires consideration of these issues.
Sound analytical skills and a strong interest in development as a researcher in the field of adult and continuing education and learning innovation.
Good report writing, communication, administrative and project management skills.
Ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team.
The successful appointee will be based in IAL Campus located at Lifelong Learning Institute at Paya Lebar.

Airalo is looking for a dynamic and motivated Data Analytics Manager to join our expanding team and support our rapid growth as we venture into multiple new global markets, while building our B2B & B2B2C offerings. Stepping into this role, you will have the unique opportunity to be one of the pioneering members of the Data Analytics team at Airalo, shaping our analytical methodologies and driving data-driven insights. The ideal candidate should have a track record of setting up and optimizing analytical processes from the ground up and possess a strong passion for technology, travel, or telecommunications.

As a Data Analytics Manager, you will play a key role in establishing a data-culture where data-driven decisions become second nature in the organization. You will be responsible for the creation, execution, and constant upgradation of our analytics strategy, leading projects and roadmap initiatives that unearth valuable insights. You will lead a team of data analysts and work closely with the data engineers and data scientists. Collaboration will be key, as you will work with various stakeholders and business functions such as Growth, Product, Engineering, finance, and Networks.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Lead and develop a team of data analysts, overseeing all analytics and BI operations
Understand business needs and objectives, develop strategies, and set up frameworks for data analysis and reporting
Drive the successful and timely delivery of actionable insights, reports and dashboards, owning the majority of deliverables for the data analytics team
Build a deep understanding of the existing and future data applications and act as the point of contact for all technical matters related to them
Define and build an A/B testing strategy and platform to set up a structured A/B testing plan and run structured tests / randomized control trials
Define and build media attribution models (market-mix models) to optimise budget allocations for media channels
Define and build pricing models and tools to make strategic pricing decisions and optimise profitability
Extract data and reports from multiple platforms, such as GA4, CleverTap, FireBase, Adjust, etc., and consolidate them to provide business stakeholders with a comprehensive perspective
Set high standards for the team by delivering high quality insights each time
Ensure data privacy policies are adhered to, overseeing BI governance and user access to the right data
Ensure that each standard procedure and workflows are properly documented for future reference and the benefit of the team
Continuously work towards achieving high performance, operational excellence, greater accuracy, and reliability of the overall system
Keep abreast of the latest trends and best practices in data and analytics and keep your team up to date
Must-haves:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Information Systems, Informatics, Analytics, or another quantitative field
Minimum 7 years of relevant industry experience in data-rich organizations and at least 5+ years of experience in analytics or data science domain
Strong project management skills and team management experience (2+ years) with exceptional abilities to handle a team of 2 - 4 data analysts
Advanced usage of analytical tools, strong ability to analyze, interpret and present data using advanced visualisation tools e.g. Quicksight, Tableau, PowerBI, DOMO etc.
Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle complex data problems
Advanced Python and SQL knowledge with experience of working with large datasets
Excellent attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality reports and analysis.
Effective communication skills to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner to senior stakeholders, both technical and non-technical
Good to Have:
Experience in ML and Python
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and database management systems.
Experience working with Internet and technology companies
Experience working with Telco, MNOs & MNVOs
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Job_Title: (Contract) Risk Analyst/Senior Risk Analyst - Risk Analytics, Intelligence & Surveillance
Description:
(Contract) Risk Analyst/Senior Risk Analyst - Risk Analytics, Intelligence & Surveillance - (230001UN)

Key Responsibilities:
Risk Analytics, Intelligence & Surveillance (RAISe) is a unit set up within Singapore Consumer Financial Services (CFS) reporting into Group Head, CFS Risk and Prevention (R&P).
RAISe team is tasked to put in place a strong risk surveillance and continuous monitoring framework and procedures to drive effective and timely risk management for CFS. This is to be achieved through leveraging on the use of technology and advance risk data analytics, risk scoring, detection and monitoring methodologies, to pro-actively identify, assess, report and work with various CFS business stakeholders to risk mitigate material risk trends and incidences to meet all regulatory and policy requirements, minimizing CFS risk to within acceptable risk appetite and achieve strong CFS risk and control oversight.
Within RAISe there will be sub-teams, each led by a Risk Surveillance Manager reporting to the Head of RAISe, covering their respective risk surveillance and monitoring scope.
FAA/SFA & Market Conduct Risk
Financial Risk
Anti-Money Laundering / Countering the Financing of Terrorism (AML/CFT) & Sanctions Risk
Operational, Fraud, Digital and Technology Risk
Risk Surveillance Managers are expected to operate in close support and collaboration across teams in risk identification and mitigation activities.
The RAISe risk analyst plays an important role in the management, testing and detection of material risk and control lapses in the day to day operations of CFS businesses. The incumbent will report into the Risk Surveillance Manager, with opportunities to rotate, lead and take ownership in one of the following areas within their respective team:
Continuous audit risk insights and findings
Continuous self-identified and monitoring risk insight, trending and findings
CFS departmental control procedures and process testing and inspections
The individual is expected to contribute towards the success of RAISe in performing the following tasks as part of their career in RAISe:
Drive data analytics capabilities in the team to enhance risk detection including in the domain of Market Conduct and Financial risk.
Run end-to-end data analytics project to conduct thorough and effective risk surveillance and testing of business process control measures to assess its relevance and robustness.
Meticulous tracking of flagged risks, ensuring stakeholders and team thorough follow through on all required actions for closure.
Validate quality of reviews conducted by business stakeholders and report on material lapses.
Accurate and timely articulation, escalation and reporting of testing and review results to management and business stakeholders on material findings for risk mitigation actions, and good practices for ongoing educational, staff recognition and positive reinforcement.
Identify potential new risk insights or trends observed on the ground for active discussion with risk surveillance managers for further trending analysis.
The Risk Analyst is expected to have regular active and tactful engagement and follow through working discussions with CFS departments during their review, testing, monitoring and reporting activities.
Key Stakeholders Management
Internal
1. CFS Departments
2. Group Audit
3. Group Legal & Regulatory Compliance
4. Group Operations & Technology
5. R&P Advisory Teams

Qualifications

Educational and Work Experiences:
Diploma or Degree holders aspiring to develop a career in risk management and surveillance using data analytics
Understanding of the data analysis pipeline, data infrastructure and work well with large datasets.
Possesses risk management, audit or compliance experience.
Added advantage for individual with i) certification in risk governance &/or risk management related courses and/or ii) certification in data analytics related courses. Basic understanding of data analysis tools and languages such as Python, Excel VBA, Qlikview or PowerBI is preferred.
Technical Skills:
General understanding of regulatory requirements for retail banking products and services.
Candidates who only possess either data background, regulatory understanding or audit background are also welcome to apply.
Personal Traits:
Able to be versatile, proactively participate in team projects and recommend analytics solutions to solve issues where appropriate
Passionate in developing a career in risk management and compliance.
Independent self-starter
Strong analytical abilities and risk assessment acumen.
Committed and focused individuals
Positive and progressive behavioural traits
Good team player
Good written and oral communication skills and ability to interact effectively with people at different levels
Forward looking and embraces technology and data analytics to drive efficient and effective risk management.

Job_Title: Analyst/Senior Analyst (Data Product Development), Data Office, SPR
Description:
What the role is
The Data Office champions the overall HR data strategy for the whole-of-government and PSD. We are responsible for end-to-end solutioning in order to drive adoption and evolution of HR data analytics across the public service.

To achieve this, the team leads initiatives relating to the refining existing practices and approaches to HR data analytics, encompassing the full spectrum of activities including infrastructure, data engineering, data operations, data governance.
What you will be working on
[Hiring ClusterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Description & Reporting Lines]
The Data Office champions the overall HR data strategy for the whole-of-government and PSD. We are responsible for end-to-end solutioning in order to drive adoption and evolution of HR data analytics across the public service.

To achieve this, the team leads initiatives relating to the refining existing practices and approaches to HR data analytics, encompassing the full spectrum of activities including infrastructure, data engineering, data operations, data governance.

[Specific Job Responsibilities]
The incumbent will be part of the Data Engineering and Infrastructure team supporting the development and subsequent improvements of a new IT system using Agile software development methodology. The new system is a central whole-of-government Public Officer data hub which serves as a data exchange between HR systems and downstream applications. It consolidates and aligns the data from various source systems before transferring the required data to the relevant downstream applications. As part of the Data Engineering and Infrastructure team, you would:

Support the Team Lead by working with the vendor, business analysts, source system owners and end users (downstream applications) to ensure smooth implementation of the system and delivery of target business outcomes
Engage both upstream and downstream system owners to ensure that the business requirements are accurately captured, and translate the business requirements into data specifications
Work with the upstream system owners to map out the data harmonisation required, and identify and resolve any data gaps
Participate in the Agile development activities and meetings
Provide support in the system development and subsequent enhancements through the reviewing of Change Requests (CR) and Service Requests (SR) specifications, User Acceptance Test (UAT) plans, coordinating and overseeing all the UATs
Conduct daily system maintenance and operations work to ensure operational readiness of the system through managing of incidents and reviewing of proposed solutions
Monitor and work with upstream system owners to resolve any data errors
Support the on-boarding process of the systems
Manage and support audit queries
What we are looking for
[Values]
We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, collaborative teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service. If you share our passion in shaping SingaporeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s future with a first-class Public Service, we welcome you to join us.

[Work Experience, Competencies]
An ideal candidate should possess the following:
[Thinking Clearly and Making Sound Judgement] Ability to examine complex problems and propose possible solutions, demonstrating good problem solving and root cause identification skills.
[Working Effectively with Stakeholders] Strong communications and stakeholder management skills, adept at exploring issues from a user-centric perspective and contributing to a collaborative working environment.
[Project Management] Good project management skills to effectively manage project milestones, timeline and drive initiatives.
[HR Data Management] Keen interest in HR data management and good understanding of data management and data quality concepts. Familiarity with HR processes will be an added advantage.
[Experience in HR Enterprise Systems] Prior experience in enterprise systems in HR (SAP, Oracle, Workday) will be an added advantage. Applicants with no prior experience are still welcome to apply.

Successful candidates will be offered a 1-year contract in the first instance.

You will be part of a team that conducts feasibility studies on various energy technologies, with a view to enhance our understanding of possible options for Singapore. The team also develops the long-term outlook, roadmap and implementation plans of these technologies.
The scope of energy technology areas includes advanced nuclear energy technologies, advanced geothermal systems, and other emerging energy technology solutions.
You will be responsible for evaluating a comprehensive set of costs and benefits of emerging energy technology, assessing its value against other energy options and determining its role in Singapore's energy mix. The considerations include (a) safety, (b) energy security, (c) environmental impact, (d) economics, (e) regulatory requirements, (f) impact to Singapore's economy, (g) social impact, etc.
You will work with both local and overseas collaborators such as research institutes, government agencies, international experts, and consultants, to conduct studies to holistically cover various aspects of the technology. These studies could include market and regulatory models for the technology and their resulting costs, calculations on the levelised cost of electricity (LCOE) /dispatch modelling to assess impact on electricity price and market, developing quantitative techno-economic modelling and simulation, working out economic impact due to social and environmental factors, etc. You will be responsible for managing and working closely with the collaborators to steer the projects and ensuring the outcomes are in line with Singapore's requirements.
You will develop and implement plans to deploy emerging energy technologies of interest in Singapore over the long term. These plans will include policy, regulatory and market frameworks necessary for the deployment of emerging technologies in Singapore. You will be required to work with other EMA departments, government agencies and external stakeholders to develop and implement these plans.
In addition, you will have to ensure that EMA's position on various energy technologies are communicated clearly and accurately to our stakeholders. This involves the ability to communicate complex technical issues in a manner that is easily understood by the general public.
Background in Economics, Business or other relevant areas.
Relevant working experience in energy markets and policy design would be an advantage.
Good knowledge and understanding of markets and policies for emerging energy technologies will be an advantage.
Good to have strong technical understanding of PLEXOS modeling, data analytics and visualisation for the purpose of developing energy fuel mix and policy frameworks.
Excellent analytical, planning and communication (written and verbal) skills are critical for this position.
Resourceful and able to integrate large volumes of information from a wide range of sources, including both open and proprietary literature, academia, international experts, etc, and derive important insights on the subject matter.
Able to represent EMA in communicating with internal and external stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Able to work well with a large number of internal and external stakeholders, and build and maintain relationships with them.
The candidate must be a problem solver who is able to work under tight timelines.
We are looking for a committed team player, with a strong interest to shape Singapore's energy landscape.

Risk lead for Marex Asia Pacific in respect of Group Operational Risk. This is a newly created role in response to significant growth at Marex. This role will be responsible for supporting, implementing, and embedding the components of the Operational Risk Management Framework. This will be a highly visible role where development of successful and supportive relationships with key stakeholders across several business disciplines will be required. By nature, the role holder will be hands-on, proactive, and anticipatory in thinking. They will also be driven and can provide significant value in delivery and be comfortable working independently.
Risk representative for Operational Risk in the region, point person for all Operational Risk matters in APAC.
Work with business areas in the region to build out Risk Registers, working to provide accurate reflection of information and challenge where appropriate.
Oversee the Risk and Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) cyclical program for the region, including agreement of Risk Assessment scoring / actions with Risk Owners (Senior Management).
Develop and evaluate the design and effectiveness of controls and provide timely and in-depth analysis to Senior Management. This includes challenging management actions to remediate control gaps or weaknesses and track through to closure. Ensure accurate reflection of risk and control information within Risk Registers by providing rigorous challenge where appropriate.
Monitor and report on Risk Events and Operational Losses escalating to management appropriately, and actively supporting business areas in the lessons learnt.
Manage and contribute to the process for evaluating and rectifying operational risk incidents, ensuring swift resolution of the incident and that client interest is central to the process, capturing root causes, lessons learnt, ensuring actions for future risk mitigation are implemented and relevance to other business areas or processes is considered.
Daily management of Broker Losses and reporting to help drive down total value, volumes and learn lessons.
Challenge requests for Risk Acceptance and provide regular review of action status until closure.
Responsible for creation of regional Operational Risk reporting for governance forums.
Stakeholder at relevant regional risk governance Boards, Committees, and governance forums. Contribution to creation of Risk Committee reporting.
Emerging risk scanning to identify disruptors in the external environment and losses which may lead to the identification of new risks.
Ongoing development of the Operational Risk Framework and roll out of individual components.
Practically maintaining strong relationships with second- and third-line assurance functions, actively participating in forums and promoting information sharing.
Provides support and guidance to embed a positive risk culture.
Lead on developing localized regional guidance and training.
The Company may require you to carry out other duties from time to time.

Experience in governance, risk, assurance, compliance, or internal control roles in Financial Services.
Strong technical risk and control knowledge.
Good knowledge of Framework methodology and practice.
Confident working independently and remotely from your team members.
Demonstrable knowledge of assurance, controls models and corporate governance frameworks.
Strong team worker and able to take initiative to scope and lead enhancement work.
Effective report writing and oral communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex requirements simply and to translate them into viable business practices and procedures.
Self-motivated and inquisitive.
Innovative/creative and passionate about driving cultural change.
Self-starter with a positive and proactive attitude.
Strong organizational and time management skills, as well as ability to work under pressure.
Ability to build constructive relationships and to influence all levels of staff to deliver cultural change.
Proactive problem-solver who is determined at chasing down actions and resolutions to completion.
Ability to work very collaboratively within a global team.
Strong Excel, Word, PowerPoint skills and experiences in the use of internal IT systems.
Use of a GRC and Power BI tools desirable.
Able to balance commercial and regulatory requirements.
Relevant professional designation desirable.
